Quick Start (TypeScript)

Build your first PhilJS application in under 5 minutes. We'll create a simple counter app to learn the fundamentals.

Create a New Project

Terminal
$npm create philjs@latest my-counter-app
$cd my-counter-app
$npm install
$npm run dev

Open http://localhost:5173 in your browser to see your app running.

Understanding the Project

Your new project has this structure:

my-counter-app/
├── src/
│   ├── app/
│   │   ├── layout.tsx      # Root layout
│   │   └── page.tsx        # Home page
│   ├── components/
│   │   └── Counter.tsx     # Example component
│   └── main.tsx            # Entry point
├── public/
├── package.json
├── tsconfig.json
└── vite.config.ts

Your First Signal

Signals are the foundation of PhilJS reactivity. Let's create a simple counter:

src/components/Counter.tsxtypescript
1import { signal } from 'philjs-core';
2 
3function Counter() {
4  // Create a reactive signal with initial value 0
5  const count = signal(0);
6 
7  return (
8    <div className="counter">
9      <h1>Count: {count}</h1>
10      <button onClick={() => count.set(c => c + 1)}>
11        Increment
12      </button>
13    </div>
14  );
15}
i

How Signals Work

When you read count in JSX, PhilJS automatically tracks it as a dependency. When count.set() is called, only the parts of the UI that depend on it will update.

Computed Values with Memos

Use memo to create derived values that automatically update:

src/components/Counter.tsxtypescript
1import { signal, memo } from 'philjs-core';
2 
3function Counter() {
4  const count = signal(0);
5 
6  // Computed value - automatically updates when count changes
7  const doubled = memo(() => count() * 2);
8  const isEven = memo(() => count() % 2 === 0);
9 
10  return (
11    <div>
12      <p>Count: {count}</p>
13      <p>Doubled: {doubled}</p>
14      <p>Is Even: {isEven() ? 'Yes' : 'No'}</p>
15      <button onClick={() => count.set(c => c + 1)}>+1</button>
16    </div>
17  );
18}

Side Effects

Use effect to run code when signals change:

src/components/Counter.tsxtypescript
1import { signal, effect } from 'philjs-core';
2 
3function Counter() {
4  const count = signal(0);
5 
6  // Run when count changes
7  effect(() => {
8    console.log('Count changed to:', count());
9 
10    // Optional cleanup function
11    return () => console.log('Cleaning up...');
12  });
13 
14  // Save to localStorage whenever count changes
15  effect(() => {
16    localStorage.setItem('count', String(count()));
17  });
18 
19  return (
20    <div>
21      <p>Count: {count}</p>
22      <button onClick={() => count.set(c => c + 1)}>+1</button>
23    </div>
24  );
25}

Building a Todo List

Let's build something more complete - a todo list with add, toggle, and delete:

src/components/TodoList.tsxtypescript
1import { signal, memo } from 'philjs-core';
2 
3interface Todo {
4  id: number;
5  text: string;
6  done: boolean;
7}
8 
9function TodoList() {
10  const todos = signal<Todo[]>([]);
11  const newTodo = signal('');
12 
13  const remaining = memo(() =>
14    todos().filter(t => !t.done).length
15  );
16 
17  const addTodo = () => {
18    const text = newTodo().trim();
19    if (text) {
20      todos.set(t => [...t, {
21        id: Date.now(),
22        text,
23        done: false,
24      }]);
25      newTodo.set('');
26    }
27  };
28 
29  const toggleTodo = (id: number) => {
30    todos.set(t => t.map(todo =>
31      todo.id === id
32        ? { ...todo, done: !todo.done }
33        : todo
34    ));
35  };
36 
37  const deleteTodo = (id: number) => {
38    todos.set(t => t.filter(todo => todo.id !== id));
39  };
40 
41  return (
42    <div className="max-w-md mx-auto p-4">
43      <h1 className="text-2xl font-bold mb-4">Todo List</h1>
44 
45      <div className="flex gap-2 mb-4">
46        <input
47          type="text"
48          value={newTodo()}
49          onInput={(e) => newTodo.set(e.target.value)}
50          onKeyDown={(e) => e.key === 'Enter' && addTodo()}
51          placeholder="What needs to be done?"
52          className="flex-1 px-3 py-2 border rounded"
53        />
54        <button
55          onClick={addTodo}
56          className="px-4 py-2 bg-blue-500 text-white rounded"
57        >
58          Add
59        </button>
60      </div>
61 
62      <ul className="space-y-2">
63        {todos().map(todo => (
64          <li
65            key={todo.id}
66            className="flex items-center gap-2 p-2 bg-gray-50 rounded"
67          >
68            <input
69              type="checkbox"
70              checked={todo.done}
71              onChange={() => toggleTodo(todo.id)}
72            />
73            <span
74              className={todo.done ? 'line-through text-gray-400' : ''}
75            >
76              {todo.text}
77            </span>
78            <button
79              onClick={() => deleteTodo(todo.id)}
80              className="ml-auto text-red-500 hover:text-red-700"
81            >
82              Delete
83            </button>
84          </li>
85        ))}
86      </ul>
87 
88      <p className="mt-4 text-sm text-gray-500">
89        {remaining()} items remaining
90      </p>
91    </div>
92  );
93}

Async Data with Resources

Use resource to fetch and manage async data:

src/components/UserProfile.tsxtypescript
1import { signal, resource } from 'philjs-core';
2 
3interface User {
4  id: number;
5  name: string;
6  email: string;
7}
8 
9function UserProfile() {
10  const userId = signal(1);
11 
12  const user = resource<User>(async () => {
13    const res = await fetch(
14      `https://api.example.com/users/${userId()}`
15    );
16    if (!res.ok) throw new Error('Failed to fetch');
17    return res.json();
18  });
19 
20  return (
21    <div>
22      <select
23        value={userId()}
24        onChange={(e) => {
25          userId.set(Number(e.target.value));
26          user.refresh();
27        }}
28      >
29        <option value={1}>User 1</option>
30        <option value={2}>User 2</option>
31        <option value={3}>User 3</option>
32      </select>
33 
34      {user.loading() ? (
35        <p>Loading...</p>
36      ) : user.error() ? (
37        <p className="text-red-500">
38          Error: {user.error()?.message}
39        </p>
40      ) : (
41        <div>
42          <h2>{user().name}</h2>
43          <p>{user().email}</p>
44        </div>
45      )}
46    </div>
47  );
48}
